curam.omega3.texthelper
Class TextHelper

java.lang.Object
  curam.omega3.texthelper.TextHelper
All Implemented Interfaces:
BOPI, curam.util.client.bopi.BOPIConstants, curam.util.client.bopi.InternalBOPI, LegacyBOPI
public abstract class TextHelper
extends java.lang.Object

The base class for all generated client-side interfaces to the application server's facade layer. Sub-classes of this class represent the "server interfaces" used in the UIM pages. The TextHelper is named for its primary role of managing the conversion of application data to the text formats displayed on the HTML pages and the parsing of text format data entered by users on HTML form pages back into the required type of application data.

This full TextHelper interface is a legacy interface that is supported only for backward compatibility. The preferred interface is the simplified Business Operation Presentation Interface (BOPI) that is also implemented by this class. The BOPI interface provides all that is necessary to use TextHelper instances when they are accessed directly in the UIM "resolve" pages (i.e., those that use a JSP_SCRIPTLET to create and populate a TextHelper before calling the server, retrieving the results and redirecting to the appropriate next page). Therefore, when instantiating an instance of a generated TextHelper, the object should be assigned to a variable of type curam.util.client.bopi.BOPI.

getFieldLabel

public final java.lang.String getFieldLabel(int arg0)
Description copied from interface: LegacyBOPI
Gets the value of the label used in the presentation layer for a field. This value is only available after the submission of form data and the population of the BOPI with the field values entered on the form. If a field does not appear on a form, it will have no label value.

Specified by:
getFieldLabel in interface LegacyBOPI
Parameters:
arg0 - The field index.
Returns:
The field label value.
